Gui module

class Gui.GuiObject

Bases: object

The GuiObject class provides functionality for creating and managing a Pygame-based graphical user interface (GUI). It handles user inputs, such as button clicks and keyboard events, and displays information on the OSD.

Parameters:

  • self.flight_mode – The current flight mode (default: “Manual”).

  • self.prev_flight_mode – The flight_mode in the previous call of self.draw().

draw(img: ndarray, data_for_osd: dict) → None

Draws the GUI on the Pygame window based on the provided image and OSD data.

Parameters:

  • img – Image of the video feed to be implemented into the gui

  • data_for_osd – Dictionary containing the data for the on screen display of relevant mission parameters

getKey(keyName: str) → str

Returns a Boolean indicating whether a specific key is currently pressed. :param keyName: Name of specific key :return: True if key is pressed

getKeyboardInput() → str

Retrieves the currently pressed keys from the keyboard.

Returns:

String which indicate the relevant keys pressed

get_search_area_size() → dict

Returns the dimensions of the search area as a dictionary. :return: dimensions of the search area as a dictionary
